value.0: The hair of a dryad is needed to create a cure for the Wailing Death. Aribeth has suggested that you start your search for it in Neverwinter Woods, east of Neverwinter.

You have met with the Archdruid Aawill, who will give you the location of a dryad in return for helping the Spirit of the Wood. Although he did not give a specific location, he has directed you to go to the heart of the Neverwinter Wood, wherever that may be. In that location should be a hidden grove that contains an altar. Spilling your blood on the altar with the special dagger he has given will bring you into the realm where the Spirit of the Wood is, at which point you are to help cure it.
You have destroyed all of the shadow druids in the Realm of the Spirit of the Wood and restored tranquility to the Spirit itself. You should return to Archdruid Aawill with this news.

Archdruid Aawill directed you back to the heart of Neverwinter Wood to find the dryad. Apparently, she was well-hidden. With the spirit saved, he has spoken to her and she is now visible to you, though he warned that she may not give up her hair upfront.
You have spoken with the dryad Elaina in the and as a result of saving the Spirit of the Wood, she has given you a lock of her hair. You should return this reagent to Aribeth.
The dryad's hair has been given to Aribeth.
A Dryad's Hair

Lysanna, the priestess of Auril in Luskan, has refused to give you temple services until you solve a little problem for them. Apparently, one of their order has fallen in love and had forsaken her duty and to Auril. 

She has requested that you eliminate her and bring back her amulet as prood of the deed. She was seen with soldier under High Captain Taerl, and is likely located somewhere in their keep.

Lysanna, the priestess of Auril in Luskan, has refused to give you temple services until you solve a little problem for them. Apparently, one of their order has fallen in love and had forsaken her duty and to Auril. 

You have retrieved the amulet and should return it to Lysanna.

Lysanna, the priestess of Auril in Luskan, has refused to give you temple services until you solve a little problem for them. Apparently, one of their order has fallen in love and had forsaken her duty and to Auril. 

You have given the amulet to Lysanna as proof of the deed and the temple services of the Winter Palace are now open to you. They have also gifted you a magic item, enchanted by the frostmaiden herself as an additional reward.
A Favor for the Frostmaiden

Kendrack, head of the mercenary guild and Mayor of Port Llast, has put out a reward for the death of five dangerous prisoners escaped from Waterdeep. Kendrack is extremely pleased that you have completed the bounties for all five prisoners and has rewarded you with a handsome amount of gold.
A Mercenary's Reward

Jemanie is worried about his brother, Torin. He has been missing for several days now, and Jemanie fears that something has happened to him. Apparently he was involved with a strange cult that may have something to do with the zombie infestation.
A man from the crypts in the Great Graveyard attacked you and was subsequently killed. A ring on his finger identified him as Torin. You should probably bring this information back to Jemanie
Jemanie has been told of his brother's death. He was understandably upset and would not be consoled.
A Missing Brother

The effects of the Wailing Death has drained Neverwinter's resources, and aid must be sought from neighboring allies in order for it to make it through such a tumultuous time. After delivering the request for supplies to Port Llast, Thundertree, and Highcliff, Olgerd has gifted you a magic bag of holding.
A Special Reward

The brain of an intellect devourer is needed to create a cure for the Wailing Death. Aribeth has suggested that you start your search for it in the Underdark, but she did not disclose where to find an entrance to it.

The brain of an intellect devourer is needed to create a cure for the Wailing Death. Aribeth has suggested that you start your search for it in the Underdark, but she did not disclose where to find an entrance to it.

You have managed to retrieve the brain of an intellect devourer. You should return the reagent to Aribeth.
The intellect devourer's brain has been given to Aribeth.
An Intellect Devourer's Brain

Nyatar has heard some disturbing news about the hunter that owns the Blacklake Zoo and how he is being abusive to the animals within. He has requested that you enter the zoo and put a stop to him, as he is worried that with the plague, he will kill the animals to cover his tracks.
The hunter in question has been killed. This should at least provide an immediate solution to the animal's troubles. You should report back to Nyatar.
Nyatar was saddened to hear the violent end of the hunter. Regardless, he gave you some gold as a reward along with a magical ring that may make it easier for you to befriend animals.
Animal Rescue

Ophala Cheldarstorn of the Moonstone Mask has requested the theft of a series of art objects from people who have been critical of her establishment. One of them, a portrait of the late Sir Reginald Rumbottom III, is said to be hidden in the Rumbottom estate in the Blacklake.
A portrait of Sir Reginald Rumbottom III has been found that appears to have the name "Ophala Cheldarstorn" written on the back. This should be returned to her in the Moonstone Mask for a reward.
The portrait has been given to Ophala and you were rewarded for it.
Art Theft: Portrait for Ophala

Ophala Cheldarstorn of the Moonstone Mask has requested the theft of a series of art objects from people who have been critical of her establishment. One of them, a statuette of the female form, is reputed to be in the Docks District estate of a certain Androd Golden.

A gaudy statuette has been found that appears to be a partially nude representation of Ophala Cheldarstorn, the famous matron of the Moonstone Mask. This should be returned to her in the Moonstone Mask for a reward.
The statuette has been given to Ophala and you were rewarded for it.
Art Theft: Statuette for Ophala

Ophala Cheldarstorn of the Moonstone Mask has requested the theft of a series of art objects from people who have been critical of her establishment. One of them, a valuable urn possessed by a man named Hodge, is somewhere in the Blacklake District.

A gilded urn has been found that appears to have suffered a roughly head-sized dent. "Best Wishes, Ophala Cheldarstorn" has been scratched into the base of it. This should be given to her in the Moonstone Mask for a reward.
The urn has been given to Ophala and you were rewarded for it.
Art Theft: Urn for Ophala

Judge Oleff Uskar has entrusted you to finding the artifacts of Halueth Never. According to him, the tomb of Miaslaznia Fairblade was ransacked and the contents were stolen. You should confront this other party and retrieve it for Oleff, wherever they may be.

The artifact from the first tomb was apparently stolen by an evil cleric of Talona. It could not be found, but at least one of the deceased excavator's Blessed Quill was found. You should bring it to Oleff for a reward.
Although the stolen artifact was never found, Jacob's Blessed Quill was returned to Oleff and you were rewarded with gold.
Artifact Recovery: A Stolen Relic
Judge Oleff Uskar has entrusted you to finding the artifacts of Halueth Never. One such tomb may be found in the Great Graveyard, located in the Beggar's Nest.
The Ancient Chronicles of Halueth Never was found in one of the tombs in the Great Graveyard. You should return it to Oleff for a reward.
The Ancient Chronicles of Halueth Never was returned to Oleff and you were rewarded with gold.
Artifact Recovery: Graveyard Tomb
Judge Oleff Uskar has entrusted you to finding the artifacts of Halueth Never. One such tomb may be found in the Docks district, possibly in the sewers or aqueducts.
The Ancient Symbol of Tyr was found in a tomb in the Docks sewers. You should return it to Oleff for a reward.
The Ancient Symbol of Tyr was returned to Oleff and you were rewarded with gold.
Artifact Recovery: Hidden Tomb

Judge Oleff Uskar has entrusted you to finding the artifacts of Halueth Never. After the recovery of all artifacts, a clue was presented that may lead to Halueth Never's actual tomb and final resting place. He suggested that you start your search in Blacklake.
There appears to be a tomb hidden inside a house in Blacklake. Apparently, speaking the name "Halueth" should open the bookcase inside the house and open the way to the tomb.
Halueth's Rusted Armor was discovered in a tomb hidden inside a house in Blacklake. You should return it to Oleff for a reward.
Halueth's Rusted armor was returned to Oleff and you were rewarded with not only gold, but a magical ring that should protect you from harm.
Artifact Recovery: Never's Tomb

Ferdinand the Ranger in the Marauder's Bay has offered to turn over the cockatrice in exchange for both an adult basilisk and an adult gorgon. He has given you a magical device capable of capturing these creatures.

Ferdinand mentioned that basilisks are more likely to be found in rockier regions inland, such as those found to the east of Marauder's Bay.

Ferdinand the Ranger in the Marauder's Bay has offered to turn over the cockatrice in exchange for both an adult basilisk and an adult gorgon. He has given you a magical device capable of capturing these creatures.

You have found and captured a basiilisk from the Valley of the Dead. It should be returned to Ferdinand once you have also captured a gorgon.
The basilisk has been exchanged with Ferdinand for the cockatrice.
With the death of Ferdinand, there is no longer any need to procure a basilisk in exchange for the cockatrice.
Basilisk for Ferdinand

While adventuring in the Underdark, you have stumbled into some drow that were surprisingly non-hostile. Apparently, their mistress has had visions of your presence and would very much like to speak with you. They should have a base somewhere in the Underdark.

You have met with the Seer, a powerful Eilistraeean priestess and leader of the drow rebels . She has told you about the Valsharess, who is a drow matron mother that bound an archdevil to her bidding and conquered much of the Underdark. Lith My'athar is one of the very few safe bastions in the Underdark, and it is likely that the Valsharess and her allies will take their conquest to the surface after their destruction. 

The Seer believes you are the only one capable of stopping the Valsharess and her massive army. She has requested your aid in weakening the Valsharess and her allies. The Valsharess is currently allied with both the beholders and the mindflayers. Severing their alliance would weaken the Valsharess significantly.

To stand against her army, the Seer and the drow rebels of Lith My'athar will need to acquire some allies. There are rumours of a nearby island inhabited entirely of golems. If these golems can be controlled, they can bolster the forces of Lith My'athar.
Battle for the Underdark

In his tower east of Port Llast, the wizard Wanev was experimenting with summoning lesser devils. However, due to the influence of alcohol, he has lost control of an imp that has opened up a portal to the Abyss and the chambers are now home to all manner of outsiders. He has requested your aid in slaying the imp, which should stop the devils from spawning.

In his tower east of Port Llast, the wizard Wanev was experimenting with summoning lesser demons. However, due to the influence of alcohol, he has lost control of an imp that has opened up a portal to the Abyss and the chambers are now home to all manner of beasts and demons. You have slain the imp and should now report back for a reward.

In his tower east of Port Llast, the wizard Wanev was experimenting with summoning lesser demons. However, due to the influence of alcohol, he has lost control of an imp that has opened up a portal to the Abyss and the chambers are now home to all manner of beasts and demons. You were given a reward for putting a stop to the imp.
Bounty: Closing the Portal
Drake has enlisted your help in destroying a risen mummy. He can be found in the Warrens of the Damned in the Great Graveyard.
You have destroyed the mummy. You should return to Drake for a reward.
You have received your reward from Drake for destroying the mummy.
Bounty: Destroy the Mummy

The Seer has been having issues with a Formian hive, located a short distance north from Lith My'athar. Due to the conflict with the Valsharess she cannot spare troops to clear it out, and has requested that you help her do this.
The Formian Queen has been slain. You should return to the Seer in Lith My'athar for a reward.
The Seer has rewarded you for destroying the Formian Queen.
Bounty: Formian Hive
Meldanen has requested that you bring him a gem of power. Apparently, they can be found on bandit mages in the roads of Neverwinter.
You have retrieved a gem of power. You should return to Meldanen for a reward.
You have received your reward from Meldanen in return for a gem of power.
Bounty: Gem of Power

The gate captain, Sindra, has enlisted your help in eliminating the leader of the goblins. The attacks appeared most frequently in Neverwinter East Road, where she has suggested for you to start your search.
You have slain the goblin chieftain. You should return to the gate captain Sindra for a reward.
You have received your reward from the gate captain Sindra for slaying the goblin chieftain.
Bounty: Goblin Chieftain

Gerrol, a farmer in the hamlet of Highcliff, has seen his life ruined by the recent activity amongst the nearby hobgoblin tribe in the southern part of High Road. He has called for the head of their tribe's leader.

Gerrol, a farmer in the hamlet of Highcliff, has seen his life ruined by the recent activity amongst the nearby hobgoblin tribe in the southern part of High Road. One of their leaders, an ogre mage, has now been killed and his head severed for presentation to Gerrol.

Gerrol, a farmer in the hamlet of Highcliff, has seen his life ruined by the recent activity amongst the nearby hobgoblin tribe in the southern part of High Road. Grateful for the vengeance offered, you were rewarded when you told him the news of their leader's demise.
Bounty: Hobgoblin Leader
Terari wants you to slay the current sirine queen. She is probably located in the same house he was staying in when he was kidnapped.
You have slain the current sirine queen. You should return to Terari for a reward.
You have received your reward from Terari from killing the sirine queen.
Bounty: Sirine Queen

Lenton, one of the archeologists lucky enough to escape from the troll caves along the plains northeast of Port Llast, lost a brother in the attack. Eager for vengeance, he has asked adventurers to return to him with the head of the troll chieftain responsible.
You have slain the current troll chieftain. You should return to Lenton for a reward.
You have received your reward from Lenton from killing the troll chieftain.
Bounty: Troll Chieftain

Aribeth has recieved news of a troubling undead upsurge in and around Helm's Hold. Now that Desther has been eliminated, she would like you to investigate the source behind this and put a stop to it if possible.
You have destroyed a lich in the underhalls of Helm's Hold, which is likely responsible for the undead. Aribeth would be interested to hear about this.
You have received your reward from Aribeth for destroying the source of the undead.
Bounty: Undead Uprising
Harben has enlisted your help in eliminating the leader of the wererats. Supposedly, he can be found in the sewers.
You have destroyed the wererat king. You should return to Harben for a reward.
You have received your reward from Harben for destroying the wererat.
Bounty: Wererat Threat

Rolkid in Highcliff has been having trouble with bugbear bandits raiding supplies coming from further north. He didn't have a good lead on where they might be hiding, but it seems he would very much like his supplies back.

Rolkid in Highcliff has been having trouble with bugbear bandits raiding supplies coming from further north. He didn't have a good lead on where they might be hiding, but it seems he would very much like his supplies back.

You found a huge amount of supplies in a Bugbear cave, not far off the High Road. Whilst they are too much for any one person to carry, Rolkid would no doubt be interested in knowing their location.
You informed Rolkid about the huge pile of supplies in the Bugbear cave. Now that the way is clear, he has sent men to go and collect them.
Bugbear Bandits
Daelan finished his tale, mentioning that he seeks an important talisman... a brooch that belonged to his mother. It is of little real value, except to him.

Daelan finished his tale, mentioning that he seeks an important talisman... a brooch that belonged to his mother. His mother's brooch having been returned to him, Daelan gave you a magic necklace from the Red Tiger Tribe.
Daelan's Tale

Kendrack, head of the mercenary guild and Mayor of Port Llast, has put out a reward for the death of five dangerous prisoners escaped from Waterdeep. They have separated to avoid detection but can all be identified by means of a tattoo on their left ear, marking them as inmates of the Bulwark prison. It is this tattoo that Kendrack wants as evidence of the deed.

Delilah, a halfling assassin who once made her home in Luskan, was last seen on the plains east of Port Llast.

Kendrack, head of the mercenary guild and Mayor of Port Llast, has put out a reward for the death of five dangerous prisoners escaped from Waterdeep. They have separated to avoid detection but can all be identified by means of a tattoo on their left ear, marking them as inmates of the Bulwark prison. It is this tattoo that Kendrack wants as evidence of the deed.

You have obtained Delilah's ear. It should be returned to Kendrack for a reward.

It is this tattoo that Kendrack wants as evidence of the deed.

Delilah's bounty has been claimed.

The feathers of a cockatrice are needed to create a cure for the Wailing Death. Aribeth has tried to arrange for the delivery of a live cockatrice, but it has not arrived at Neverwinter yet.

The feathers of a cockatrice are needed to create a cure for the Wailing Death. Aribeth tried to arrange for the delivery of a live cockatrice, but somehow in the chaos of the Wailing Death it has broken loose. There have been reports of various creatures becoming petrified outside Neverwinter's southern gate, where it likely now resides.

The feathers of a cockatrice are needed to create a cure for the Wailing Death. There have been reports of various creatures becoming petrified outside Neverwinter's southern gate, which could be the work of a cockatrice or other magical beast that has broken free in the chaos of the Wailing Death.

Having tracked down the cockatrice and obtained the cockatrice from Ferdinand the Ranger, you now possess some of its feathers. These should be returned to Aribeth as part of the plague cure.
The cockatrice feathers have been given to Aribeth.

The feathers of a cockatrice are needed to create a cure for the Wailing Death. Aribeth tried to arrange for the delivery of a live cockatrice, but somehow in the chaos of the Wailing Death it has broken loose. There have been reports of various creatures becoming petrified outside Neverwinter's southern gate, where it likely now resides.

You have tracked the cockatrice to a cave in the Marauder's Bay, but a ranger named Ferdinand has already recaptured the cockatrice and intends to sell it off. He has agreed to exchange the cockatrice for the capture of both an adult gorgon and an adult basilisk. Alternatively, the feathers could be taken by force - though this looks like it would be a very difficult battle.
Feathers from a Cockatrice

Gerrol, a farmer in the mountain town of Highcliff, has seen his life and livelihood ruined by the recent activity amongst the nearby humanoid tribes. Worst of all, his wife, Leah, was recently captured by hobgoblins and taken away for some horrible purpose.

Gerrol, a farmer in the mountain town of Highcliff, has seen his life and livelihood ruined by the recent activity amongst the nearby humanoid tribes. Worst of all, his wife, Leah, was recently captured by hobgoblins and taken away for some horrible purpose. 

Unfortunately, she was already dead when their camp was investigated. If at least her wedding ring can be returned to Gerrol, he will have something to remind him of their former life together.

Gerrol, a farmer in the mountain town of Highcliff, has seen his life and livelihood ruined by the recent activity amongst the nearby humanoid tribes. Worst of all, his wife, Leah, was recently captured by hobgoblins and taken away for some horrible purpose. 

Unfortunately, she was already dead when their camp was investigated. You were at least able to return her wedding ring to Gerrol, so that he could have something to remind him of their former life together.
Gerrol's Wife

Ferdinand the Ranger in the Marauder's Bay has offered to turn over the cockatrice in exchange for both an adult basilisk and an adult gorgon. He has given you a magical device capable of capturing these creatures.

Ferdinand mentioned that he had heard rumors of a cave inhabited by gorgons south along the coast.

Ferdinand the Ranger in the Marauder's Bay has offered to turn over the cockatrice in exchange for both an adult basilisk and an adult gorgon. He has given you a magical device capable of capturing these creatures.

You have found and captured a gorgon from the cave in the Waterfall Beach. It should be returned to Ferdinand once you have also captured a basilisk.
The gorgon has been exchanged with Ferdinand for the cockatrice.
With the death of Ferdinand, there is no longer any need to procure a gorgon in exchange for the cockatrice.
Gorgon for Ferdinand
The heart of a pure-blood yuan-ti is needed to create a cure for the Wailing Death. Aribeth has suggested that you start your search for one in the Mere of Dead Men, south of Neverwinter.

The heart of a pure-blood yuan-ti is needed to create a cure for the Wailing Death. Aribeth has suggested that you start your search for one in the Mere of Dead Men, south of Neverwinter.

You have slain and taken the black heart of Gulnan, one of the most powerful pure-blood yuan-ti. You should return the reagent to Aribeth.

The heart of a pure-blood yuan-ti is needed to create a cure for the Wailing Death. Aribeth has suggested that you start your search for one in the Mere of Dead Men, south of Neverwinter.

Gulnan's heart has been given to Aribeth.
Heart of a Pure-Blood Yuan-Ti

In order to put a stop to the Luskan war with Neverwinter, you need to eliminate all of the High Captains of Luskan.

Aarin Gend has informed you of High Captain Baram, who is one of the older High Captains but supposedly still dangerous. Once he is slain, you should report back to Aarin.

In order to put a stop to the Luskan war with Neverwinter, you need to eliminate all of the High Captains of Luskan.

Aarin Gend has informed you of High Captain Baram, who is one of the older High Captains but supposedly still dangerous. You have slain him and should report back to Aarin.

In order to put a stop to the Luskan war with Neverwinter, you need to eliminate all of the High Captains of Luskan.

Aarin Gend has informed you of High Captain Baram, who is one of the older High Captains but supposedly still dangerous. He is now dead and you have been rewarded for your efforts.
High Captains of Luskan: Baram

In order to put a stop to the Luskan war with Neverwinter, you need to eliminate all of the High Captains of Luskan.

Aarin Gend has informed you of High Captain Kurth, who is a brutish warrior. Once he is slain, you should report back to Aarin.

High Captains of Luskan: Kurth

In order to put a stop to the Luskan war with Neverwinter, you need to eliminate all of the High Captains of Luskan.

Aarin Gend has informed you of High Captain Rethnor, who has a son named Kensidan "The Crow". Once the High Captain is slain, you should report back to Aarin.
High Captains of Luskan: Rethnor

In order to put a stop to the Luskan war with Neverwinter, you need to eliminate all of the High Captains of Luskan.

Aarin Gend has informed you of High Captain Suljack, who is an assassin that dabbles in many traps. Once he is slain, you should report back to Aarin.
High Captains of Luskan: Suljack

In order to put a stop to the Luskan war with Neverwinter, you need to eliminate all of the High Captains of Luskan.

Aarin Gend has informed you of High Captain Taerl, who is a skilled weaponmaster. Once he is slain, you should report back to Aarin.

In order to put a stop to the Luskan war with Neverwinter, you need to eliminate all of the High Captains of Luskan.

Aarin Gend has informed you of High Captain Taerl, who is a skilled weaponmaster. You have slain him and should report back to Aarin.

In order to put a stop to the Luskan war with Neverwinter, you need to eliminate all of the High Captains of Luskan.

Aarin Gend has informed you of High Captain Taerl, who is a skilled weaponmaster. He is now dead and you have been rewarded for your efforts.
High Captains of Luskan: Taerl

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

The Boatman in the ports to the East will be able to transport you there.

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

The golems Ferron and Aghaaz and their followers are at war with one another over their allegiance to the Maker. Ferron has offered you aid against the Valsharess in return for the power source guarded by Aghaaz, which he wishes to have so that he may leave the island.

As a reward for quelling the rebellion against the Maker, the golem Aghaaz has promised golems to help in the fight against the Valsharess. The Seer has rewarded you for gathering allies to her cause.

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

The golems Ferron and Aghaaz and their followers are at war with one another over their allegiance to the Maker. Aghaaz has offered you aid against the Valsharess in exchange for Ferron's head to quell the golems rebelling against the Maker.

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

The golems Ferron and Aghaaz and their followers are at war with one another over their allegiance to the Maker. Both golems have offered you aid against the Valsharess: Ferron seeks the power source guarded by Aghaaz so that he may leave the island, and Aghaaz wishes Ferron's destruction for turning his back on the Maker.

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

You have encountered and destroyed the the golem named Ferron, and collected his head. As there were signs of conflict at the entrance of the level, the other side may be interested to know about this.

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

At the request of Aghaaz, you have destroyed the the rebel golem named Ferron and collected his head. This should be returned to Aghaaz in order to recieve his aid against the Valsharess.

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

At the request of Aghaaz, you have destroyed the the golem named Ferron in exchange for assistance against the Valsharess in the form of some of the Maker's golems, though Aghaaz has cautioned you against venturing deeper into the ruins. The Seer would no doubt be interested in hearing about this.

You have encountered and destroyed the the golem named Aghaaz. As there were signs of conflict at the entrance of the level, the other side may be interested to know about this.

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

You have encountered and destroyed the the golem named Aghaaz, and collected some kind of glowing power source that he was guarding. His enemy, Ferron, might be interested to learn of this.

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

The golem Ferron seeks the power source controlled by his opponent Aghaaz. Aghaaz has been destroyed, though the power source he once guarded cannot be far away.

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

The golem Ferron seeks the power source controlled by his opponent Aghaaz in order to leave the Maker's island. Aghaaz has been destroyed and the power source is now in your possession, which should be returned to Ferron to secure aid against the Valsharess.

The Seer told you of a nearby island that is supposed to be inhabited completely by golems. If you could find a way to control these constructs, you could use them against the Valsharess and her army.

You have delivered the power source to Ferron so that he may leave the Maker's isle in exchange for assistance against the Valsharess in the form of some golems, though Ferron cautioned you against venturing deeper into the ruins. The Seer would no doubt be interested in hearing about this.

As a reward for procuring the power source required for him to leave the island, Ferron has promised golems to help in the fight against the Valsharess. The Seer has rewarded you for gathering allies to her cause.
Isle of the Maker

Just before the East Road gate, you met with Cosnach whose wife, Jolie, had been kidnapped by goblins. The halfling is offering a reward for her safe return. According to him, the goblins should not be too far from residing road.
You have found Jolie alive and well, who is making her way out of the goblin village. You should return to Cosnach with the news.
After returning to Cosnach, he has rewarded you with a magic weapon, as promised. Now that his wife is home, perhaps his belly will also be full.
Kidnapped by Goblins
Linu finished her tale, mentioning that she hopes to find the Sacred Chalice of Moonbow somewhere during her journey.

Linu finished her tale, mentioning that she hopes to find the Sacred Chalice of Moonbow somewhere during her journey. Pleased that the sacred chalice was returned to her, Linu gifted you with a magic pendant of the Elves.
Linu's Tale

The Seer has told you of an illithid city that has allied itself with the Valsharess. The illithid who serve the Valsharess come from a number of different colonies, and serve a number of different Overminds. However, it may be possible to persuade one of the Overminds to convince the others to withdraw their support of the Valsharess.

The small illithid colony of Zorvak'Mur is located somewhere in the Underdark. While killing the Zorvak'Mur Overmind will accomplish nothing, negotiating with it could result in all the Overminds abandoning the Valsharess.
Mindflayers of Zorvak'Mur
Janken, in the druid encampment of Neverwinter Woods, has requested that you find the whereabouts of his missing daughter, Bree. She should be somewhere in Neverwinter Woods.
Bree has been found and is making her way back to camp. You should check in with Janken.
Bree is now back at camp safely, and Janken has rewarded you for her safe return.
Missing Druid: Bree
Henna, in the druid encampment of Neverwinter Woods, has requested that you find the whereabouts of her dear friend, Orlane. He should be somewhere in Neverwinter Woods.
Orlane is dead. You should inform Henna of the bad news.
Henna has rewarded you with gold when you informed her of the news of her deceased friend Orlane.
Missing Druid: Orlane
Elgar, in the druid encampment of Neverwinter Woods, has requested that you find the whereabouts of his friend, Terari. He should be somewhere in Neverwinter Woods.
Terari has been found and is making his way back to camp. You should check in with Elgar.
Terari is now back at camp safely, and Elgar has rewarded you for his safe return.
Missing Druid: Terari
Ophala Cheldarstorn, the famous matron of the Moonstone Mask, has bestowed upon you a magical cloak in return for the jobs you have done for her.
Ophala's Gift

The Seer has told you of a faster passage between the Underdark and the surface, which passes through the volcanic Mount Hotenow. In the southeastern Underdark, there was a gate and outpost of Drow construction built to prevent the creatures of fire from entering the Underdark, but in the turmoil caused by the rise of the Valsharess the Drow were unable to defend it, leaving it to fall into the the control of the Duergar. The Seer suggests that a key to the sealed gate might still be found there.
You have successfully retreived the key for the Drow gate from the Duergar occupiers, allowing easier passage between the surface and the Underdark.
Passage through Mount Hotenow

After fighting your way through both a lair of Formians and Spiders in the eastern Underdark, you encounted an unusual obelisk drawing on magical power behind a gate. Strangely, above this place appears to be signs of Beholder activity, though there is no way to reach the Beholder tunnels from so far below. It is not clear why creatures of such magical power would leave such an obelisk alone.

After fighting your way through both a lair of Formians and Spiders in the eastern Underdark, you encounted an unusual obelisk drawing on magical power behind a gate. Strangely, above this place appears to be signs of Beholder activity, though there is no way to reach the Beholder tunnels from so far below..It is not clear why creatures of such magical power would leave such an obelisk alone.

You have made your way to the obelisk and removed a strange orb from it, which seemed to be powering its dispelling effects. Perhaps the presence of the obelisk might have been what forced the beholders out of the cavern, and maybe the orb still retains some of its magic draining abilities that might be useful...

Regardless, it seems there is nothing else to do in the obelisk cavern.

You found a strange obelisk in the tunnels beneath the Beholder lair of the Underdark, and removed the orb powering it. It seems that simply carrying this orb is sufficient to absorb some of the magic from Beholder rays, significantly reducing their potency. This will be a great aid when fighting against them, as the Seer has asked of you. There was however no way to enter the lair itself, meaning that a frontal assault will still be necessary.

The Seer has suggested that there might be an easier passage to the Beholder Lair through a tunnel just north of the entrance to Lith My'athar. She has said it is full of Formians, and there is no guarantee that the passage will still lead you all the way there.
Passage to the Beholder Lair

The prison in the Peninsula is in trouble. Apparently there is a riot going on, and unless it is stopped it is likely that the inmates will escape terrorize the city. The head gaoler Alaefin will have more information on how to contain them.
According to head gaoler Alaefin, the prison rioters are seemingly led by Kurdan, a vicious murderer. Killing him will probably stop the riots from getting any worse.
Kurdan has been killed. The head gaoler Alaefin will want to know about this.
With Kurdan's death, the prison rioters will soon lose their fight and the risk of the prisoners escaping is gone.
Prison Riot

Husher in Highcliff has offered to pay handsomely for the recovery of a particular Star Sapphire from Layenne's Tomb. According to Husher, this can be found somewhere in the valleys and mesas of the northeast.

Husher in Highcliff has offered to pay handsomely for the recovery of a particular Star Sapphire from Layenne's Tomb. According to Husher, this can be found somewhere in the valleys and mesas of the northeast.

After many trials and dealing with three different tombs, you managed to recover the Star Sapphire from the Valley of the Dead. It should be returned to Husher.
Husher in Highcliff paid handsomely for the Star Sapphire from Layenne's Tomb in the Valley of the Dead.
Recover the Star Sapphire

On the way to the prison, Bethany has pleaded with you to go inside the prison and rescue her sister, Balinda. Apparently, she joined as a new warden shortly before the prison riots have started, and she has not been heard from since.
You have found Balinda alive and she is making her way out of the prison. You should return to Bethany.
You have returned to Bethany and she was delighted to have Balinda back, although she is recovering at home. She gave you chainmail armor as thanks for your help.
Rescuing Balinda

Sharwyn completed her tale, mentioning that her mother still lives in Neverwinter. Her mother, however, has contracted a serious disease known as bonerot... and Sharwyn hopes to find the cure for the disease somewhere in the city.

Sharwyn completed her tale, mentioning that her mother still lives in Neverwinter. Her mother, however, has contracted a serious disease known as bonerot. Sharwyn was pleased to receive the cure for her mother's disease, and gave you a magic belt that once belonged to a bard she fell in love with.
Sharwyn's Tale

You have met with Meldanen, but before he will give you information on a cure, he asks that you retrieve his "Spellbook of Inescapable Mazes" from inside the maze itself. Apparently it was stolen by one of his apprentices, who accidentally sent herself into a maze when escaping.
The book has been found, but all the pages had turned to dust, rendering it useless. Meldanen will not be pleased, but there is nothing more you can do.
Meldanen has been notified that his book was destroyed. Surprisingly, he was still willing to show his knowledge of the Wailing Death to you.
Spellbook of Inescapable Mazes

Olgerd has requested that you send in a request for lumber from the mountain town of Highcliff, located south of Neverwinter along the High Road.

You have spoken to Elder Mayne and he has agreed to send a shipment of lumber to Neverwinter. You should return to Olgerd with the news.

Olgerd has requested that you send in a request for herbs and medicines from the village of Thundertree, located along Neverwinter River. The healer in Thundertree has accepted your request and will send some medical supplies to Neverwinter. You should return to Olgerd with the news.

Ander, who currently spends his days at the Inn of Good Omens in Highcliff, warns of a terrible tragedy that has befallen him. Sir Karathis Ironheart, a travelling werewolf hunter, enlisted the help of four boys to hunt a foul lycanthrope known only as the Black Wolf. It was a trap, however, and Sir Karathis was himself the Black Wolf. His claws raked the flesh of Bran, Urth, and Geth, infecting them with his dread disease, leaving only Ander himself to escape.

Ander is desperate for someone to help find his friends and perhaps find a cure for their lycanthropy. He suggested that you seek out Neurik, who has a temple in the mountain side of Highcliff.

Neurik believes that, if found soon enough, the three young men may still be curable by a charm he has concocted. You should return to Ander with this information.

Anders was pleased to know that the Black Wolf no longer plagues Highcliff, and he has given you a magic item as a reward for your efforts in not only stopping the beast, but also for saving his friends.
The Black Wolf

You have been provided a silver charm which can cure someone who has recently became a werewolf, and if they are injured enough to be considered badly wounded.

According to Ander, Bran likes to visit Grizzly Lake, which is northeast of Highcliff.
You have cured Bran of lycanthropy. You should return to Ander with the news.
Ander was relieved to know Bran was cured of lycanthropy.
The Black Wolf: Curing Bran

You have been provided a silver charm which can cure someone who has recently became a werewolf, and if they are injured enough to be considered badly wounded.

According to Ander, Geth used to go to Waterfall Beach often, which is northwest of Highcliff.
You have cured Geth of lycanthropy. You should return to Ander with the news.
Ander was relieved to know Geth was cured of lycanthropy.
The Black Wolf: Curing Geth

You have been provided a silver charm which can cure someone who has recently became a werewolf, and if they are injured enough to be considered badly wounded.

Ander does not know where Urth may be, though his family may know. They live on a farm outside of Highcliff.
You have cured Urth of lycanthropy. You should return to Ander with the news.
Ander was relieved to know Urth was cured of lycanthropy.
The Black Wolf: Curing Urth

A strange outcast ghoul has been encountered in the sewers beneath Luskan, envious of his 'brother' who holds an amulet that retains the last of their mortal power. He has offered to reward you should you manage to take the amulet from the ghoul lord and return it to him.
The amulet belonging to the ghoul lord has been obtained. The strange outcast ghoul offered a reward to you should that amulet be returned to him.

A strange outcast ghoul has been encountered in the sewers beneath Luskan, envious of his 'brother's' amulet... a magical device which he claims holds the last of their mortal power. The amulet has been returned to him and the ghoul seemed pleased... even though he did warn you to never return.
The Ghoul Lords of Luskan

The Seer has told you of a hive of beholders that have allied themselves with the Valsharess. The beholders who have joined the Valsharess all come from a single hive somewhere in the northern Underdark. Apparently there was an underground tunnel which connected to the hive located slightly north of Lith My'athar, but it has since been overrun with Formians.

It is unlikely you will be able to reason with them: if you want to weaken the Valsharess, you will have to kill the hive mother leading the colony.

The Seer has told you of a hive of beholders that have allied themselves with the Valsharess. The beholders who have joined the Valsharess all come from a single hive somewhere in the northern Underdark. Apparently there was an underground tunnel which connected to the hive located slightly north of Lith My'athar, but it has since been overrun with Formians.

The hive mother leading the beholder colony has been slain. You should report the news of its demise to the Seer.
The Seer has rewarded you for destroying the Beholders allied with the Valsharess.
The Hive Mother

News of the Wailing Death have spread far and wide. Luskan, a sworn enemy of Neverwinter, had caught wind of it and are making preparations to attack Neverwinter in it's weakened state.

Nasher has given you orders to seek out Aarin Gend, who was sent on a mission to infiltrate Luskan.

News of the Wailing Death have spread far and wide. Luskan, a sworn enemy of Neverwinter, had caught wind of it and are making preparations to attack Neverwinter in it's weakened state.

Nasher has given you orders to seek out Aarin Gend, who was sent on a mission to infiltrate Luskan. After consulting with him, the plan is to assassinate all of the High Captains in Luskan, which should stop the Luskan war in it's tracks.

However, getting inside the city will not be easy. It is currently in lockdown and impossible to enter the normal way. Aarin has told you of an alternative path - an entrance to the abandoned mines which may have a connection to the Luskan sewers. The mines themselves appear to be infested with umber hulks, though.

Moving through the city may prove to be another hurdle. Aarin described some sort of magical attunement that the Arcane Brotherhood has casted which allows wardens in the city to easily distinguish intruders. These wardens should be avoided at all costs as Aarin warns, or the might of the Luskan army may be brought onto you immediately.
The Luskan War

A nobleman by the name of Hemmel Masterson is huddled near the docks with his family. He gave a valuable amulet to Jalek, who appears to be in the Bloodsail pirate's guild, in an arrangement whereby the Masterson family hoped to escape quarantine by ship. Jalek seems to have left them high and dry, however, opting to keep the amulet for himself.

You have come into possession of an expensive-looking amulet etched with the name 'Hemmel Masterson.' Hemmel is a nobleman huddled in the Golden Apple in the docks with his family. He gave the amulet to Jalek of the Bloodsail pirate's guild, in an arrangement whereby the Masterson family hoped to escape quarantine by ship. As it seems obvious that there is no ship, the amulet should be returned to Hemmel for a reward.
Hemmel's amulet has been returned to the Masterson family and you were rewarded with gold.
The Masterson Amulet

The infamous adventurer, Elaith "The Serpent" Craulnober appears to have at last become homesick for the land of Evermeet he fled so long ago. He and his daughter are currently staying at an inn in Port Llast, searching for three gems that will help them make the journey home. Unfortunately, the gems are not in the hands of people interested in parting easily with them.

One of the gems is the personal treasure of Setara, a witch of the Neverwinter Wood.

Trolls have captured Janis, the mother of Revat, a simpleton along the northeastern plains from Port Llast. He is situated in the archaelogist camp there, and you have agreed to help him find his mother. He has given you a ring so Janis can recognize that you are a friend.

Trolls have captured and imprisoned a woman named Janis in the caves along the northeastern plains from Port Llast. Coincidentally, the ring entrusted to you by her simpleton son Revat was able to break the magical bonds that held her, and she was able to escape. You should return to Revat for the news.
You have rescued Revat's mother from certain peril and as a reward, he has decided to bestow upon you his father's magical ring.
The Simpleton's Mother

In the Docks district, there is a gang of thugs who are known as the "Sword Coast Boys". They have been attacking people under the chaos of the Wailing Death and must be stopped. Harben Ashensmith in the Docks district should have more information.

Harben has "interrogated" some Sword Coast Boy members and they noted that their leader is Drawl. Apparently they seem to be coming from the aqueducts and their hideout is in the connected sewers. He and any other members of his gang are wanted dead.
Drawl, the leader of the Sword Coast Boys, has been killed. Harben should be delighted to hear about his demise.
With Drawl's death, the Sword Coast Boys will soon dwindle and the threat to the docks will be minimized.
The Sword Coast Boys
The strange village of Charwood is buried deep within the forest that shares its name. It is shrouded by sheets of deep blue mist and seems to exist beneath a pall of endless night.

The strange village of Charwood is buried deep within the forest that shares its name. It is shrouded by sheets of deep blue mist and seems to exist beneath a pall of endless night. At the entrance, a madman by the name of Quint greets newcomers with riddles before disappearing in a puff of blood-drenched smoke. Inside the village proper, the townsfolk seem to be lost in a haze of confusion and forgetfulness, repeating their words endlessly into the chill night air. Perhaps there is something forboding in Castle Jhareg, which looms over the settlement's eastern edge.

Inside the castle, one is met by a Guardian Spirit who claims that Lathander, god of the morning, has allowed this place to slip between the weave of time, pending the arrival of someone willing to stand in Judgment over the two brothers, Quint and Karlat Jhareg, who are said to have been involved in some horrendous, though unspoken crime. Karlat is said to be confined within the southern tower while Quint, the madman at the gate, is supposedly confined within the northern tower. Whoever wishes to stand in Judgment must learn what facts they can of the case, obtain the written oaths of these two brothers, and present them to the Guardian Spirit.

You have delivered their written oaths, placed your judgement, and have been rewarded for your part in this ordeal.
The Village of Eternal Night

The demon Belial, Lord of Fire, has been bound to Castle Jhareg's haunted halls to present further evidence in the case of the brothers Jhareg. The two lords of Charwood stand accused of an unspeakable crime by the Guardian Spirit on the castle's main floor and she would no doubt be interested in seeing the written oath that Belial has so recently provided.

According to the demon's account, he lied to Karlat, his original summoner, claiming the slaughter of the village children was necessary if the sorcerer was to become a baelnorn. Belial appears quite proud of this tragic subterfuge, flaunting it readily. He does not fear Judgment, as any return to the Abyss will be a triumphal homecoming for him. It would be wise to consider this evidence carefully.
The Village of Eternal Night: Belial's Oath

Karlat Jhareg, one of the two lords of Charwood who currently stand accused by the Guardian Spirit on the castle's main floor, has been discovered in a cell within his west tower. He has the skeletal form of a half-lich, though he claims that the end result of his long-interrupted ritual will be to become a baelnorn, a noble and highly respected type of lich within elven tradition. He blames the slaughter of the village children on his maddened brother, Quint, who he also accuses of stealing an all-important magical phylactery, thereby interrupting Karlat's ritual and trapping the spirits of everyone in the area.
The Village of Eternal Night: Karlat's Oath

Quint Jhareg, one of the two lords of Charwood who currently stand accused by the Guardian Spirit on the castle's main floor, has been discovered in a cell within his eastern tower. The former cleric of Lathander now seems quite mad and very much plagued by guilt over the death of the village children within this castle so long ago. Quint readily admits to gathering the children into the castle on midwinter's eve so long ago and also to stealing his brother's phylactery. He has begged that he be punished for his crimes.
The Village of Eternal Night: Quint's Oath

As the Wailing Death spread across Neverwinter, it was soon apparent that it was not a natural affliction. It couldn't be cured by normal means, and the holiest of clerics found their divine healing useless. To fortify the city and aid in investigating the plague, Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande called for all adventurers of promise to attend the Neverwinter Academy. 

You are one of the adventurers who have answered that call. To begin your initiation, speak to Sedos in her office at the academy.

You have been permitted to freely leave and return to Neverwinter as you please in pursuit of these reagents.

Setara, a witch deep in the Neverwinter Wood, claims to have once been a beautiful maiden. Apparently the sirines elsewhere in the forest have a mirror that can return her to her former beauty. Setara has offered an amulet that can prolong the wearer's life to whoever can return retrieve a mirror for her.
A mirror was retrieved from the sirine queen. A Mirror of Vanity, it will show whoever looks into it a reflection of great beauty. You should return it to Setara for a reward.

You have given the mirror to Setara, and she bestowed upon you an amulet that can prolong the wearer's life. Unfortunately for her, it would seem that her appearance is only changed inside the mirror and not in the real world.
The Witch's Mirror

Mary O'Deel, a cattle rancher in the road outside Highcliff, is having trouble with some wolves that have moved into the area. She's given the leader of the pack the name of Silverback and is offering a reward for her head. Silverback apparently makes her den in a cave just north of Mary's home, though the direct location is unknown.

Mary O'Deel, a cattle rancher in the road outside Highcliff, is having trouble with some wolves that have moved into the area. She's given the leader of the pack the name of Silverback and is offering a reward for her head. 

Silverback's den is in a cave lies in a waterfall cave off the road near Mary's home. After entering the cave, you have slain the beast and retrieved her head. You should return it to Mary for a reward.

She has given you an adequate amount of gold for your troubles, as well as a trinket that her son left behind when he went left the farm.
The Wolf Mother

The wizardess Eltoora seeks a collection of ancient tomes from the lost civilization of Imaskar. The five books are said to act as recipes, providing guidance to those undertaking magical experiments. Should any of the tomes be found, she will reward them with gold and a magical book that can enhance one's ability. Through scrying attempts, she managed to narrow down the locations of the five tomes of Imaskar.

The Tome of Death is said to be found towards Helm's Hold.

Tomi finished his tale of his life in Calimshan, mentioning that he had come to Neverwinter originally in search of an old friend that was to forge some documents for him. Tomi fears his friend might be dead but hopes to locate the documents somewhere in the city.

Tomi finished his tale of his life in Calimshan, mentioning that he had come to Neverwinter originally in search of an old friend that was to forge some documents for him. Pleased that the documents were found, Tomi gave you a magic ring that once belonged to a wizard.
Tomi's Tale

The Beggar's Nest is struggling under an infestation of Undead. It is not known if it is related to the Wailing Death or not. The man to speak to about this is Drake. He can be found at a blockade outside the Great Graveyard.
Drake has noted that the undead seem to be pouring out of the great graveyard. He has asked you to investigate it and destroy the source of the undead.
The resident necromancer behind the undead infestation was a cleric of Cyric called Jared. He was hostile and was killed. Drake should be notified of this news.
With Jared's death, no more dead shall rise from the grave.
Undead Infestation
What Lurks Below
